column4: Is this right? GTK themes change panels & buttons?  Then what does window manager themes change?
window decoration normally.
some machines i got show uop the flash drive as usb-fdd, some show it as a usb-hdd, some show it as a actual hard drive. perhaps it showing up as somthing else.
The only things listed are Cd-rom, usb-fdd, ide, and lsb120

ive also had usb-flash disks setup in some odd way that they would boot on 4 out of my 5 machines.. but that 5th one.. was problematic.. then other flash drives worked find on that one... Test it out on other machines.. see if it boots on any others.
Yes it does work on other machines, except just that particular machine
on one box. I had to enable the 'lba' flag on the  flash drive to get it to boot.
How do I enable the lba flag?
gparted can do that
Ok thanks :) I'll give it a try

Hi, I tried the LBA method and it did not work as well.  I think the computer is the problem since it won't even detect bootable cdrom as well, which is weird because i triple checked the boot order and it still fails to detect.  Maybe the bios is really old?  Its Award BIOS

Hi, I tried the LBA method and it did not work as well.  I think the computer is the problem since it won't even detect bootable cdrom as well, which is weird because i triple checked the boot order and it still fails to detect.  Maybe the bios is really old?  Its Award BIOS.
at lesat you narrowed down the issue..  could try some diffrent usb ports on the machine.. but that may not help.
Yes I tried that as well :/ still same problem
There was this primary master slave thingy maybe that's it?
that wouldent affect usb drives.
try disabling all the other drives in teh bios perhaps?
okay i'll give that a try
not that will do miuch good.. but it might  at lesat be a test.
Ok thanks :)
best way to answer that is try out  an alpha5 cd..
ok thanks
because untill you try.. any answer you get on IRC.. is just a guess.
